rev.comment: adding new method by wich they accept donations ([[Bitcoin]])
rev.diff:
Line 34: Line 34:
The wikileaks.org domain name was registered on 4 October 2006.<ref name="whois">{{Cite web|title=Whois Search Results: wikileaks.org|url=http://who.godaddy.com/WhoIs.aspx?domain=wikileaks.org&isc=ALEXADOM|work=GoDaddy.com|accessdate=10 December 2010}}</ref> The website was unveiled, and published its first document, in December 2006.<ref name="TIME">{{Cite news |title=WikiLeaks' War on Secrecy: Truth's Consequences |date=2 December 2010 |author=Calabresi, Massimo |url=http://www.time.com/time/world/article/0,8599,2034276-3,00.html |work=Time |location =New York |accessdate=19 December 2010 |quote=Reportedly spurred by the leak of the Pentagon papers, Assange unveiled WikiLeaks in December 2006.}}</ref><ref name="Khatchdourian"/> The site claims to have been "founded by Chinese dissidents, journalists, mathematicians and start-up company technologists, from the US, Taiwan, Europe, Australia and South Africa".<ref name="aboutwikileaks">{{Cite web |url=http://www.wikileaks.org/wiki/WikiLeaks:About |title=Wikileaks:About |publisher=WikiLeaks |accessdate=3 June 2009 |archiveurl=http://web.archive.org/web/20080314204422/http://www.wikileaks.org/wiki/Wikileaks:About |archivedate=14 March 2008}}</ref>
The wikileaks.org domain name was registered on 4 October 2006.<ref name="whois">{{Cite web|title=Whois Search Results: wikileaks.org|url=http://who.godaddy.com/WhoIs.aspx?domain=wikileaks.org&isc=ALEXADOM|work=GoDaddy.com|accessdate=10 December 2010}}</ref> The website was unveiled, and published its first document, in December 2006.<ref name="TIME">{{Cite news |title=WikiLeaks' War on Secrecy: Truth's Consequences |date=2 December 2010 |author=Calabresi, Massimo |url=http://www.time.com/time/world/article/0,8599,2034276-3,00.html |work=Time |location =New York |accessdate=19 December 2010 |quote=Reportedly spurred by the leak of the Pentagon papers, Assange unveiled WikiLeaks in December 2006.}}</ref><ref name="Khatchdourian"/> The site claims to have been "founded by Chinese dissidents, journalists, mathematicians and start-up company technologists, from the US, Taiwan, Europe, Australia and South Africa".<ref name="aboutwikileaks">{{Cite web |url=http://www.wikileaks.org/wiki/WikiLeaks:About |title=Wikileaks:About |publisher=WikiLeaks |accessdate=3 June 2009 |archiveurl=http://web.archive.org/web/20080314204422/http://www.wikileaks.org/wiki/Wikileaks:About |archivedate=14 March 2008}}</ref>
â
The creators of WikiLeaks have not been formally identified.<ref name="NewScientist1">{{Cite news |author=Marks, Paul |title=How to leak a secret and not get caught |url=http://www.newscientist.com/channel/tech/mg19325865.500-how-to-leak-a-secret-and-not-get-caught.html |work=[[New Scientist]] |location =London |date=12 January 2007 |accessdate=28 February 2008 |archiveurl=http://www.huliq.com/5711/how-to-leak-a-secret-and-not-get-caught |archivedate=11 January 2007}}</ref> It has been represented in public since January 2007 by [[Julian Assange]] and others. Assange describes himself as a member of WikiLeaks' advisory board.<ref name="afp07">{{Cite news |agency=[[Agence France-Presse]] |work=The Age |location=Melbourne |title=Chinese cyber-dissidents launch WikiLeaks, a site for whistleblowers|url=http://www.theage.com.au/news/Technology/Chinese-cyberdissidents-launch-WikiLeaks-a-site-forwhistleblowers/2007/01/11/1168105082315.html |date=11 January 2007 |accessdate=17 June 2010}}</ref> News reports in ''[[The Australian]]'' have called Assange the "founder of WikiLeaks".<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.theaustralian.com.au/news/rudd-government-blacklist-hacker-monitors-police/story-e6frg8yx-1225718288350 |title=Rudd Government blacklist hacker monitors police |work=The Australian |location =Sydney |author=Guilliatt, Richard |date=30 May 2009 |accessdate=17 June 2010}}</ref> According to [[Wired (magazine)|''Wired'']] magazine, a volunteer said that Assange described himself in a private conversation as "the heart and soul of this organization, its founder, philosopher, [[spokesperson]], original coder, organizer, financier, and all the rest".<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.nytimes.com/2010/10/24/world/24assange.html |work=The New York Times |title=WikiLeaks Founder on the Run, Trailed by Notoriety |date=23 October 2010 |last1=Burns |first1=John F. |last2=Somaiya |first2=Ravi |accessdate=19 December 2010}}</ref> {{As of|2009|6}}, the site had over 1,200 registered volunteers<ref name=aboutwikileaks/> and listed an advisory board comprising Assange and eight other people.<ref name="ab">{{Cite news |last=Rintoul |first=Stuart |title=WikiLeaks advisory board 'pretty clearly window-dressing' |url=http://www.theaustralian.com.au/news/nation/wikileaks-advisory-board-pretty-clearly-window-dressing/story-e6frg6nf-1225967895242 |accessdate=18 December 2010 |newspaper=The Australian |location=Sydney |date=9 December 2010}}</ref>
+
The creators of WikiLeaks have not been formally identified.<ref name="NewScientist1">{{Cite news |author=Marks, Paul |title=How to leak a secret and not get caught |url=http://www.newscientist.com/channel/tech/mg19325865.500-how-to-leak-a-secret-and-not-get-caught.html |work=[[New Scientist]] |location =London |date=12 January 2007 |accessdate=28 February 2008 |archiveurl=http://www.huliq.com/5711/how-to-leak-a-secret-and-not-get-caught |archivedate=11 January 2007}}</ref> It has been represented in public since January 2007 by [[Julian Assange]] and others. Assange describes himself as a member of WikiLeaks' advisory board.<ref name="afp07">{{Cite news |agency=[[Agence France-Presse]] |work=The Age |location=Melbourne |title=Chinese cyber-dissidents launch WikiLeaks, a site for whistleblowers|url=http://www.theage.com.au/news/Technology/Chinese-cyberdissidents-launch-WikiLeaks-a-site-forwhistleblowers/2007/01/11/1168105082315.html |date=11 January 2007 |accessdate=17 June 2010}}</ref> News reports in ''[[The Australian]]'' have called Assange the "founder of WikiLeaks".<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.theaustralian.com.au/news/rudd-government-blacklist-hacker-monitors-police/story-e6frg8yx-1225718288350 |title=Rudd Government blacklist hacker monitors police |work=The Australian |location =Sydney |author=Guilliatt, Richard |date=30 May 2009 |accessdate=17 June 2010}}</ref> According to [[Wired (magazine)|''Wired'']] magazine, a volunteer said that Assange described himself in a private conversation as "the heart and soul of this organization, its founder, philosopher, [[spokesperson]], original coder, organizer, financier, and all the rest".<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.nytimes.com/2010/10/24/world/24assange.html |work=The New York Times |title=WikiLeaks Founder on the Run, Trailed by Notoriety |date=23 October 2010 |last1=Burns |first1=John F. |last2=Somaiya |first2=Ravi |accessdate=19 December 2010}}</ref> {{As of|2009|6}}, the site had over 1,200 registered volunteers<ref name=aboutwikileaks/> and listed an advisory board comprising Assange and eight other people.<ref name="ab">{{Cite news |last=Rintoul |first=Stuart |title=WikiLeaks advisory board 'pretty clearly window-dressing' |url=http://www.theaustralian.com.au/news/nation/wikileaks-advisory-board-pretty-clearly-window-dressing/story-e6frg6nf-1225967895242 |accessdate=18 December 2010 |newspaper=The Australian |location=Sydney |date=9 December 2010}}</ref>. June, 15th, 2011, wikileaks began accepting donations in [[Bitcoin]].<ref>http://twitter.com/#!/wikileaks/status/80774521350668288</ref><ref>http://blogs.forbes.com/andygreenberg/2011/06/14/wikileaks-asks-for-anonymous-bitcoin-donations/</ref>
